Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "希望提供slot的扩展特性" (#7182) at vuejs/vue
Opened issue "Virtual DOM replacement with template literals library (viperHTML)" (#7181) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Ease of manual DOM manipulation, performance, and console errors

### What does the proposed API look like?
Usage of https://github.com/WebReflection/viperHTML library.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Props in children routes not working" (#1922) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/z611lrnq24](https://codesandbox.io/s/z611lrnq24)

### Steps to reproduce
So I have following routes setup:

```
import Vue from 'vue'
import Router from 'vue-router'
import Home from '@/components/Home'

Vue.use(Router)

export default new Router({
  routes: [
    {
      path: '/',
      name: 'Home',
      component: Home,
      props: { adops: null }
    },
    {
      path: '/features',
      name: 'Features',
      component: Home,
      props: { adops: 'features' },
      children: [
        {
          path: 'hpto',
          name: 'Hpto',
          component: Home,
          props: { adops: 'target_hpto' }
        },
        {
          path: 'inread',
          name: 'Inread',
          component: Home,
          props: { adops: 'target_inread' }
        }
    }
}
```

When I go to the route "/feature" I get the correct string in my adops objects `adops = "features"`. 

The moment I visit the children routes *for example*: `/features/hpto`, my prop object doesn't change (it keeps it's parent value, in this case `adops = "features"`)

### What is expected?
adops = target_hpto

### What is actually happening?
adops = features

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Props in children routes not working" (#1922) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/z611lrnq24](https://codesandbox.io/s/z611lrnq24)

### Steps to reproduce
So I have following routes setup:

```
import Vue from 'vue'
import Router from 'vue-router'
import Home from '@/components/Home'

Vue.use(Router)

export default new Router({
  routes: [
    {
      path: '/',
      name: 'Home',
      component: Home,
      props: { adops: null }
    },
    {
      path: '/features',
      name: 'Features',
      component: Home,
      props: { adops: 'features' },
      children: [
        {
          path: 'hpto',
          name: 'Hpto',
          component: Home,
          props: { adops: 'target_hpto' }
        },
        {
          path: 'inread',
          name: 'Inread',
          component: Home,
          props: { adops: 'target_inread' }
        }
    }
}
```

When I go to the route "/feature" I get the correct string in my adops objects `adops = "features"`. 

The moment I visit the children routes *for example*: `/features/hpto`, my prop object doesn't change (it keeps it's parent value, in this case `adops = "features"`)

### What is expected?
adops = target_hpto

### What is actually happening?
adops = features

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Array computed property" (#1075) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/kobimilan995/50wL7mdz/80973/](https://jsfiddle.net/kobimilan995/50wL7mdz/80973/)

### Steps to reproduce
Hello. I m using vue/vuex with laravel, and i m having problems with array computed property. The example is similar to attached jsfiddle. The computed property in the component doesn't seem do watch over a state.statuses when i push elements on to it. Even if i log the statuses, in vuex, i can see statuses being added, but not in the component.

### What is expected?
Expected to see statuses appearing dynamically.

### What is actually happening?
Nothing is happening. I dont see any statuses.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
